"Making my way downtown..." Amy sung to herself as she skipped merrily along. She would've continued, but she couldn't remember the lyrics. Rehumming the line to herself, Amy reached out and nearly found the words, but a quick trip over her feet left her face down and dazed in the grass.

"What... Happen...?" Amy droned out as her head began to throb, the pain subsiding as a warm fog enveloped her thoughts. She could feel something was wrong, too, as her eyes crossed. "What's...?" Was all she could manage as her mind melted, leaving her much more confused and much, much stupider.

"Ooh..." Amy moaned, her head bobbing a little back and forth as she sat up. Anyone could tell you she looked brainless. Eyelids half lidded, drool dripping out her open mouth, and body loose and limp. Her brain, emptied of all substance, was too weak and feeble for complex thoughts, and could only really keep her alive and barely sentient. Though, she still could, technically, function, because even if her vocabulary was in the triple digits, and her education was utterly wiped, and her IQ lower than room temperature, she knew her name, her friends, and enough manners to get by in basic conversation--if her partner spoke slow enough.

111322.content:
Though her intellect was ground down to nearly nothing, Amy found a tantalizing scent in the air and followed. Thinking with her stomach, she stumbled clumsily into a nearby forest. If she had the brains to do so, she would've wondered why there was such a scent of cooked food coming from the forest or why the forest was getting unnaturally dark around her, but, with her tiny mind, all she could do was drool and follow.

After a bit of walking, the hedgehog found a lit up clearing. In the center of the pretty looking glade, there was a massive table of meats and bread and fruits, all masterfully prepared. The setup triggered a small concern, but she was too moronic to comprehend it.

Nearly diving face first into the meal, Amy buried her face in a honey glazed ham, coating her face in sticky, sugary glaze and ravenously consuming the dish in seconds. Without a hint of grace or tact, she merely burped and kept up her feast. Unnaturally, the pink glutton stuffed herself silly, eating dish after plate after meal after fattening meal in the span of minutes what should have taken days, all the while packing on the pounds.

Her mind so far gone, it didn't even notice the slight jiggle in the back or the weight behind her pounces. Amy's consciousness was flipped off even to the point where her flabby arms were visibly plump and she struggled and sweated just to crawl from dish to dish. By the time her body was too stuffed to move, she began to wonder "what feel funny...?"

Though by then, she was too tired and heavy to move and sleepiness cloaked herself until it covered her completely like a heavy blanket. And so Amy slept. She would wake in a couple hours able to move and think much easier than now, but much slower than she should. Downgraded to a fat and heavy dunce, the ribbon knew its job was done and set off to gather more subjects.

"Hey, Peach." Daisy greeted, smiling down to the soon to be dumber blonde. "You fell asleep, so I figured I'd carry you home."

"Oh..." Peach mumbled, the words tripping as they struggled to get out of her mouth. "Tha's... nice..."

"Yes. I'm a nice girl." Daisy reaffirmed.

"Nice... girl..." Peach's brow furrowed at her response.

Daisy, noting this, put on a sweeter voice and urged, "Relax, Peach, relax...!" The poor girl, so dazed, leaned back and nearly fell asleep right there. "That's good, that's good...! You always were a silly girl."

"Because you were always such a delight to have around!" Daisy giggled, then waited for the ditz to return the gesture. "That little laugh and those sweet blue eyes would always lift our spirits."

The princess giggled.And she kept giggling. Giggling was fun. She didn't always know what to do, but she could always giggle and then everything would be okay.

"You're like a pretty painting. But better!" Daisy waited for the girl to giggle and giggle at the mention of her prettiness. "And even with your... eating habits and girth, your pure and innocent personality would shine through! No matter how heavy you got!" For emphasis, Daisy gently jiggled the girl.

Curiously, the princess poked her belly. It wasn't much, but there was certainly a little jiggle.

"Since you were always such a soft girl, having a soft body just sort of fit." Daisy saw a sharpness start to return to the girl's dull eyes. "And that's really what you are, Peach." Luckily, Daisy still got a giggle of confirmation as the girl's trance was starting to break. "Soft."

"Soft...?" Peach giggled as she fell out of her trance and back to consciousness. "What're you talking about, silly~?"

"You asked me what word best described you, Princess." Daisy grinned knowingly.

"Oh," Peach pouted. "I'm sorry, I, like, forgot..." And the punctuated the sentence with a timid giggle.

"Oh, that's more than okay." Daisy gently let the princess down to her feet and then patted her on her pretty little head.

It was a relaxing day. The sun poked gently between tree branches and puffy clouds, the grass was slightly dewy but not too dewy, and the princess was lazing contentedly on a hilltop basking and mewling happily. It was... nice.

"Hey, Peach." A relaxed and friendly voice called.

"Mmm...?" Peach responded lazily, eyes half open and turning to answer the call. Peach wasn't dumb, normally, but she wasn't... particularly smart, either. Of course, even if she was, the apple tasting liquid had cooked her brain into semi-mushy stew, and it showed. The focus and presence she held was gone, and disciplined, regal demeanor had devolved to slack jawed awe. "Huh...?"

Daisy frowned at her grinning friend. "I was just... coming to ask if you wanted to come see a movie with me."

"Ooh, that sounds like fun!" Peach giggled and stood up clumsily.

"Hey, Peach," Daisy began, offering a hand to help stabilize her seemingly dizzy friend. "Are you okay?"

"Huh?" Peach asked, mouth agape.

"You seem kinda distracted." Daisy offered tentatively.

"Oh, I'm jus'..." Peach was smiling a dopey smile. "Uh..." Her smile turned to a frown as a bit of drool gathered on her lip. "Jus'... tired, tha's all...!" She was giggling and smiling again.

"Well, if you say so." Daisy dismissed nonchalantly. Peach was definitely acting strangely, but, hey, everyone needs a drink sometimes, right? Or... an... alcoholic mushroom, or... whatever it is Peach drinks for pleasure.

"Hey, Daisy, are we there yet?" Peach yawned, her fuzzy head slowly lulling her to sleep.

"Almost, Peach, just a couple blocks." Daisy answered patiently. It was the third time Peach had asked that exact question, but rudeness wouldn't help anyone, and she didn't mind playing nanny too much. "Want me to carry you?" She joked.

Peach stopped and held her arms out expectantly. Laughing, Daisy lifted Peach--with some serious difficulty--and carried her the last hundred feet to the theater.

Waddling up the the theater, Daisy gently set the heavier Peach down onto a bench. The theater was small, and kinda rundown. No broken windows or mold, but still pretty... crummy. It had an old, cozy feel to it, though, and even if it didn't have neon lights or a fresh paint job, the theater's inviting attitude was... relaxing, to say the least.

"Two for... Huh?" Daisy tried to ask, but found that the ticket booth was empty. "Hello?" She asked, knock, knock, knocking. It says it's open... Daisy thought, walking past the ticket counter and to the front door. Lights on...

"Hey, Daisy, where are we...?" Peach murmured, walking up to her friend and yawning.

"Oh, I carried you to the theater." Daisy explained, and opened the door for her sleepy friend.

"Ah, thanks." Peach yawned, flashing a dopey, sleepy smile to her friend.

"Well, this place looks pretty cool." Daisy noted as she entered the theater's surprisingly tall and roomy main lobby.

"--s, yes, I understand." A Toad's voice echoed from a theater door as it gently swung open. "Oh!"

"Hey." Daisy waved politely. "Are you guys open?"

"Yes, sorry about that!" The Toad cried, fast walking over to the two and handing them a ticket. "Here."

Daisy raised an eyebrow. "Oh, thanks?"

"Mmm?" Peach murmured, wiping the sleep from her eyes and giggling. "Thanks!"

"Sorry, we're a little understaffed--I'm, I'm actually th-the only one here." The Toad choked out, wiping some sweat from its brow. "The tickets are for theater three, snacks are behind me, and, today, everything's free!" He tiredly did a little hand wave and panted lightly.

"Oh, don't worry, man, we won't tell your boss." Daisy offered, gently tapping the Toad's shoulder.

"Oh..." The Toad said, sighing and relaxing a little. Its shoulders relaxed and a little smile graced its face. "Th-thanks...!"

"Keep up the good work!" Daisy cried as she began leading Peach by the hand and walking to their theater.

"Oooh, let's get some snacks!" Peach enthused as the toad waved goodbye.

12122112.content:
"Hm...?" The princess moaned, eyes fluttering open. "Wha...?" She tried to say more, but everything was fuzzy and dizzy and she couldn't think...

"Greetings, Princess!" A gruff voice grated on her ears.

"Bowser...?" She had to focus, but eventually saw her captor's body appear in the foggy room.

"How's the head?" The brute guffawed. "I'd say you're not feeling too bright anymore, am I right?"

"What...?" She shook her head, the fog clearing. "I'm plenty smart..."

"Oh really?" He folded his arms and stepped back. "Then why don't we test that brain of yours out?"

It was then that she noticed that she couldn't move. Her head and arms were locked into place with metal braces, and something was on top of her head. "Let me go you monster!!"

"Princess!" Bowser feigned disgust, nodding his head. "I'm hurt that you'd be rude to yer host!"

"You kidnapped me!" She kept struggling until the braces tightened. "Ack!"

"No, princess." Bowser chuckled, and the lights went out. "I mean host of the Mushroom Kingdom's hit new game show!" A spotlight shone onto him. "Smart! Or! Stupid!"

The lights came on full power this time to reveal a colorful and intricate set. The theme song started to play. She couldn't turn her head, but saw an audience of goombas and koopas and thwomps and all the others sitting behind cameras that filmed her and Bowser.

"What is the meaning of this?!" She tried to shift or move even a bit, but couldn't manage.

"The rules are so simple, even a gal like you could understand 'em." Bowser said. "If you answer a question wrong, you get stupider!"A cartoonish sounding buzzer played. "If you answer it right, then you get a point."

"And how do you plan to do that?" Peach taunted. "Another potion?"

"Nope!" The audience laughed. "If you haven't figured it out, then you should know that the machine on your head is a state of the art brain drainer!"

She gulped. Something told her this wasn't a bluff. "What happens if I win?"

A ding sound effect rung. "If you get 'em all right, then we let you go!" Then the music stopped. "But," He brought up a single finger. "If you get even one wrong, you have to do what I say!"

She sighed. "I don't have a choice, do I?"

"Nope!" He cried, and cleared his throat. "First Question!"

The ding played again, and Bowser stomped his foot. "Correct!" The next green circle filled the ground. "But you won't be so lucky this time! The questions only get harder from here! What is Princess Daisy's kingdom called?"

"Sarasaland." Peach smirked. This was going to be easier than she thought! On the ding, she was halfway there.

Bowser growled again, little flecks of smoke popping out of his nostrils. It took him a second, but he calmed down. "Correct." Creepily enough, though, he started to smile. "Since you're doing so well," He grinned a little bigger. "You get a bonus!"

"Oh no..." She mumbled out, bracing herself for the news.

"We have some questions for--!"

"Settle down, Kain." Golbez silenced with a relaxed wave of his hand to the, admittedly, seemingly smitten dragoon.

"O-of course..." Kain murmured, his head bowing in... shame? Funny. Did he swear fealty to this creature? He wasn't one to go back on previous arrangements of honor, though I once thought he wasn't one to betray his friends, so I suppose assumptions aren't accurate.

"Rosa Farrell, white mage of Baron and partner of Cecil Harvey, dark knight of Baron, I have no reason to harm you at this present moment." Golbez began with enough arrogant authority to sicken even the most spineless servants. "But," He stared through me for a split second--probably expecting some form of petty defiance--before resuming. "If you attempt to disobey, sabotage, or flee, then Kain will be..." Kain shifted? Or was that the darkness of the room? "Unsatisfied with me."

"Understood." I nodded, knowing that this was not the time nor the place to fight. Patience and plotting would see me through.

"Excellent." Golbez enthused with somehow the bare minimum of enthusiasm that one could put into an enthused statement. I could almost imagine what villainous smile he had under that helmet, and I couldn't stop a frown.
13511.title: Interrogation Transformation: Choices Round One

choices: Turns out it's just a Cactuar monster, but all they do is run away...! Right??
13512.content:
It was hot. It was scorching. It was sweltering. It was burning. It was--this was not helping her case.

The search for Cecil was a desperate one, far more trying than Rosa could have ever imagined, but it was one, all the same, she had to take. Baron was rotting, it seemed, the stench lingering far and wide, but without a trace of what meat lay festering. Her Dark Knight had fallen out of favor, recently, but was admired and respected by military and civilian populations alike. If anyone could set things right, it would be him. Also she missed her dumb, pretty boyfriend, and there's no way he could die to something so small as a quadruple earthquake/rock slide.

But all the determination in the world was worthless if she'd run out of water in the deserts of Kaipo. Like she had. Heat stroke and fever could make you go crazy!

"Hah hah!" Rosa laughed at the word crazy, tongue cracked and eyes stinging with the last of her water draining out as tears. "Look...!" She cried, suddenly pointing to something. "An oasis!!"

"Oh, thank the gods--Never mind, that's just a cactus." She corrected, turning away and stepped back towards Sand Dune #143. "Damn..."

Then there was an epiphany. "But cacti contain water!"

"Let's go!!" She cried, stumbling and falling over and over to the green thing.

"Nooo...!" Rosa moaned, trembling and crying into the burning desert sand. "Cactaur...! Pl..." Rosa wheezed, her body collapsing limp. Vision fading, body aching, the Cactaur stopped, turned, and smiled. "uhhh..."

*****

Rosa woke heaving and breathing hard, eyes jerking and searching for bearings. Moonlight through the window, leaves whistling in desert wind, and a clay room for her to rest. Wherever... Whatever happened, wherever she was, there was... She was...?

"Aah!" Rosa cried as the cactaur shuffled oddly into the room. Memories flowing back to the gentle flow of the near river, Rosa stared at the monster, blood rushing, eyes widened, as it shuffled awkwardly into the room and placed a tray and goblet beside her bed. "Hello...?" She asked while the out of place monster quickly stepped back out the room and into the moonlit desert oasis.

Still a little hazy from heat stroke which should have killed her, her weakened body struggled to sit up.
135121.title: Desert Oasis

1351211.content:
She took a couple breaths and struggled, wincing and whimpering at the pangs of pains. After a painful four tries, she burned some mana on a cure and shivered in ecstasy as the spell tingled and tickled gently around her body. Magic usually felt centered and strong, but the nature of her injuries forced the flow of magic over the whole of her person rather than the bruised knees and burnt feet.

Shaky, she sat up and grabbed the platter and glass from the nightstand. What lay there was, to her weary and starved eyes, a thing of true beauty. Soft, toasted loaf around the ends of fresh crisp lettuce, bountiful smoked pork, what looked to be some kind of mustard, grilled onions, melted cheese, and sauteed mushrooms blurred the edges of Rosa's vision and made her faint.

Ravenously, Rosa's breasts, legs, belly, and face puffed a bit per bite, doughy flesh bounding bouncily forward in form of fat. There wasn't enough fluff to break the spell that sandwich had had on Rosa's desperate and hungered mind, but, to an outsider, her legs plumped, her gut bulged, and her bust strained her bra.

About halfway through the meal, Rosa grabbed the odd shaped glass and drank. It tasted sweet and warm and cozy, and, on account of the dizziness present shortly after, probably had a bit of alcohol. Though, in truth, it was merely made from her mind. Memories of love and care from family and small bits of study and training swirling around the surface of the mug and her mind were blurred. Not burned or melted away, the superficial facts and unimportant memories merely snuggled into a blanket and hibernated for later use.

And with a small, embarrassed burp the slowed, softened Rosa breached for air. With half the sandwich and a fraction of the drink gone, sleepiness gently washed in waves over the ditzy white mage. She was still hungry, but the meal could wait til tomorrow. Yawning, she nestled between the warm sheets and sighed.

13512112.content:
Waving a goodbye to the cactus monster, Rosa placed a hand on her bloated belly. Perhaps that sandwich was heavier than she thought, though, in her situation, that might be for the best. She didn't know how far it was to kaipo, and the supplies she packed would only last a couple days if she rationed well.

But that was no reason to falter. If Cecil escaped, then he would have motioned towards Kaipo.

He had to be there.

Stepping into the hot dry sunlight, Rosa grit her teeth. She didn't have a choice, but that did not serve to help her morale.

And so she walked for hours upon hours, expertly managing heat, salt, and water as she had read in survival training. By the time the sun set, she'd covered a good two or three miles more than she'd planned to. Not that the poor Mage could track such a thing. It just felt that way, and comforted her to think as such.

But, with the heat dropping off fast, she suddenly had to deal with the monster that had stalked her that last hour. Campsites near monsters were only acceptable in havens or under a teammates watch, she recalled, knocking an arrow and taking aim.

Any second, the Lamia would cross the hill and enter her line of sight.

Any second...

Any...

Oh. Very well. Rosa smiled, tiredly clearing a sand pit for a campfire and tent. Finally, some luck.

With the damage done, the monster left only a slight trail which, within minutes, would be blown away by the desert wind. Her victim none the wiser.

"Oh my Goodness!"
Zelda let out a gasp as she finally realised what her notes were pointing her to. She had spent days poring over them, trying to decipher the old Hylian text. But she had literally been looking at it the wrong way. The text had been upside down and back to front, something Zelda didn't realise. She had wondered for a while why she had a recipe for a delicious dish.

"A new upgrade for the Sheikah Slate... Interesting..."
Glancing over at the brown tablet, Zelda smiled. She was always looking for ways to improve the slate, no matter how small they were. Grabbing it, Zelda rushed out of her room. Thankfully, the area was close by, and there would be no need for Link to accompany her. After all, what was the earliest that could happen?

Reaching the spot that the notes pointed her to, Zelda was disappointed to find that there was nothing there, bar a tree bearing some odd fruit.
"Well, that is disappointing..." Zelda sighed, looking up at the tree. "I suppose I shouldn't return without a souvenir of some sort".
Jumping up, Zelda managed to grab hold of one of the lower branches. Despite being rather lithe, the branch snapped, causing green fruit to rain down upon her.

Dodging a couple, Zelda reached down and grabbed one. Taking a bite, Zelda let out a moan. It was delicious! It reminded her of an Apple, although it had a slight salty taste to it...

Pushing her way through the thick bushes, Mipha sighed. She was definitely not suited for these long walks through areas that had no water. Her jewellery clinked against her red scales as she raised her spear to cut through yet more bushes. Before she brought it down, she paused. She swore she heard something...

Listening closely, Mipha heard it again.
"Blurgh... Urple..."
Narrowing her eyes, Mipha sliced through the bushes and leapt through. Upon landing, she levelled her spear, ready for combat.

She had expected Chu-Chus. Instead, she found Zelda lying face down in the dirt.
"Princess!" She gasped, kneeling next to her. Rolling Zelda over, Mipha instantly realized that something was wrong. Her blue eyes stared past Mipha, completely devoid of anything suggesting intelligence. Looking closer, Mipha saw that drool was caked on her chin, along with some dirt.

"Princess! Can you hear me?" Mipha gave Zelda a light shake. Zelda responded with an incomprehensible string of words, worrying Mipha even more.
"We need to get you home!" Mipha said, lifting Zelda and draping her around her shoulders. She was by no means light, but she could handle her.

"Hm...!" Mipha groaned, her cheeks flushed red with frustration. She could carry the princesses' svelte form, and she could stand to walk a dozen miles on water, and she could fight off a couple of goons if it came down to it, but doing all three was really starting to take its toll.

She wasn't a fighter, she was a healer! This was a job for anyone else. Why did it have to be her that found Zelda and why was the princess so dazed? Was she poisoned? What kind of poison incapacitated someone so inelegantly? Wouldn't her enemies just kill her? Was she playing into some trap--what was that?!

Whirling around, the Zora heaved wearily her polearm. This was too much. She couldn't fight for much longer. "H-Hello...?" Taking a trembling step back, she said again, "H-Hello? Is any--Aghh!" But tripped over a root and fell back on a tree. "Ow..." She rubbed her head, a sense of dizziness resulting from the fall.

Zelda was splayed out on the ground to her left, but looked fine otherwise. What caught her attention after, though, filled her with first relief, then joy, then hunger. The rustling in the bush hadn't been an enemy, but, instead, a fruit! And not just any fruit, but a fat and juicy one. She hadn't eaten all day, and there had to be water inside...!

With a sigh, Mipha gave a silent prayer. Perhaps today is to be a good day after all. She thought, smiling and picking the biggest one off the ground. With a dainty bite, she tasted a most wondrous flavor and sweetness. Perhaps she'd plant a tree of this in the domain once she got another chance to go home.

Savoring the taste for as long as she could, Mipha swallowed and sighed again, contented. A smile still on her face, she patted her belly softly.

"... Yes..." The ditzified Raven nodded back slow.

"Yeah, like, I get it." Raven scoffed, hurt at herself having insulted her intelligence. Or... something. "But why are you me?"

"Okay!" She agreed, not wanting to be mean to herself. Even if she was kind of a jerk. "What's the mission?"

"Find the champions. Capture the princess." The voice was kind of fuzzy now too. "Take down her guards and friends if you have to--but ONLY if you HAVE to."

"Um... Okay!" Raven giggled, a bit of her knowledge reclaimed.

And yet, he couldn't do anything to her. The Yiga could torture, they could kill, they could capture and kidnap. But when it came to other members of the Clan, you could nothing without consent. And with the way Raven was, he'd be lucky to get consent to breathe near her.

Looking at the still struggling Yiga, an idea dawned on him. It was brilliant, one worthy of Master Kohga himself. The man grinned as he looked around in the boxes of fruit behind him. There was a very specific piece of fruit that he needed...

"Come... On... Silly!" Raven gasped. She was making no progress with Zelda, but she wasn't giving up. There were still loads of shops they needed to check out!
"Hey. Take one of these".
Raven looked down to see a familiar looking fruit shoved under her nose. She shook her head.
"No! Silly don't need ya fruit!"
The man shook his head in an apparent change of mind.
"It'll help her. But, it'll take a little time to work".

Raven narrowed her eyes for a second before smiling.
"Kay!"
She took the fruit and dropped it into Zelda's mouth. Zelda chewed slowly, her eyes unfocused and glazed.
"There. Give it a little time. Now, how's about you help me? Gets mighty lonely out there".
Raven smiled. The man had helped her fix her Silly. It'd be rude not to help.

"Alright. Now, we just have to sell fruit".
Raven tilted her head.
"Sell fruit?"
The man nodded slowly. Hopefully he had enough patience to deal with her...
"That's it. However, if any of these people come around, we have special deals for them".
He pointed to two posters. One had a red mermaids with pretty jewellery on her fin, while the other had dark skin and vibrant red hair. She looked familiar to Raven, but she just couldn't remember.
"Kay!"
15533112212222122222111111122212111211.title: Becoming a fruit seller

choices: Oh well. Back to being a totally cute shop girl!
Checking the back, Raven can't find Zelda anywhere! (Something Else)
155331122122221222221111111222121112111.content:
"Thanks for buying my fruit!" Raven giggled girlishly with her hands locked behind her back, unconsciously giving the nice lady a small show.

"Anything for you, sweetie." The woman reached over and ruffled the girl's hair rather condescendingly, but Raven didn't take offense. Personal space wasn't as tight for her, and this pretty lady seemed nice. "Find me in the Southern Market if you have the time." With a wink, she strolled down the alley, humble dress just barely touching the ground.

Looking down at the pile of rupees before her, Raven smiled simply. She wasn't all about the money, but having this much of it made her feel... happy? Maybe that wasn't the feeling, but she'd never had this much before. Maybe this is what real happiness felt lik--

"Whoa!" The shopkeep cried as he strolled up to the booth, eyes popping at the sight. "Where'd this come from?!"

"The pretty lady." Raven bubbled, her soft face lolling back and forth as she stared into the sparkling red pile. Something told her to ask the man about where he'd gone about twenty minutes ago, but she ignored it. If she talked to him for real then she'd have to make eye contact to be polite, but if she did that then she couldn't look at the shinies. "She bought, um... one, two, three of the goodest fruit and the juicy fruit."

He laughed and scooped it all up. It seems Raven's... demeanor encourage a bit of overcompensation from patrons. "This'll be great for the cause!"

"Wh-wha?!" Now her eyes popped. "B-B-But--!!"

"No buts," He frowned, brow furrowing. "Er... What was your name again?"

"Oh, it's, like, Raven." She giggled, the shock melting away. She really liked when people asked her about her name, since it was a reminder of how pretty it sounded and how pretty she was for having Raven colored hair. ... What was she thinking about?

He chided and waggled a finger. "No buts, Raven." Then walked off down the alleyway.

"Hehe..." She giggled at what sounded to her like the word butt. She had a butt. It was pretty good. Maybe Zelda's was better? She hadn't seen it in awhile, so it was hard to tell.
155331122122221222221111111222121112111.title: No Special Customers?

choices: Remembering about Zelda, Raven rushes to check on her.
The man asks Raven to help him restock.
1553311221222212222211111112221211121111.content:
Giggling to herself as she thought about how nice Zelda's butt was, Raven headed back out to the front of the stall. So far, she had served loads of people, and all of them had commented on how nice she looked. The pretty lady had even told her to go somewhere!

"Like, get some totally delicious fruit!" Raven called out, waving a handful of brain fruit around in one hand and a fat fruit in the other. "All money helps the cause!"
The man, who was just observing Raven at this point, shook his head.
"There's no cause. She's just delusional!" He called out, correcting Raven. "Yep! Like, no cause here! Just super delicious fruit!" Raven added.

The man shook his head again. While she was very effective at bringing people to the stall, she wasn't very discrete. Sure, she probably couldn't remember what her cause was, but other people might twig on and bust the entire operation. Then, they'd both be in huge trouble, given that a very obese and very dumb Zelda was lying in the back of the tent.

"I'll take some!"
"Me too!"
"Don't forget about me!"
Raven began to sweat. There were too many people, and she didn't have enough hands.
"Like, Mister?" She called over to the man. "Raven needs help!"
The man nodded. It was his stall, after all. And it was likely Raven wouldn't be around forever.
"Alright, people!" He shouted over the many requests of the crowd. "Form another line over here!"
A large crowd quickly formed before him. Between the pair, they just about finished all the requests.

"Like, look at all the sparkles!" Raven squealed. She was currently holding a silver Rupee in one hand, and a sparkling gold one in the other. The way they sparkled entranced Raven, she could look at them forever...
"For the cause!" The man shouted over, dropping another gold rupee into a box filled with loads of other gold rupees. They had sold practically all of his stock, except for one box which was half empty.

Raven pouted and reluctantly dropped the two rupees into her box. Grabbing the box, the man cracked a smile.
"Thanks for today," he said, surprising Raven.
"Like, thanks!" She giggled. "Raven was happy to help!"
1553311221222212222211111112221211121111.title: The busiest stall in Castle Town

choices: Make her mind malleable and open to control.
15533112212222122222111111122212111212.content:
Watching the slightly pudgy Yiga Assassin trying her best to move the near immobile pile of flab that was Princess Zelda, the man couldn't help but grin. It was like him trying to push a boulder. Ultimately, he'd make a little progress, but at the cost of all his energy and time.

"You won't move her, you know that?" The man told Raven, who was now trying to push Zelda with her back. She stuck her fingers in her ears and shut her eyes.
"Lalalalalala~" She sung loudly. "I can't hear you~"
Looking out the front of his stall, the man saw that he was beginning to attract attention to himself. If she kept this up, she'd draw the guards here, and then they'd both be in trouble.

Closing the flaps, the man rolled the cure fruit around in his hand. Given that she had refused it, and was trying to help her sworn enemy, the man had an idea. It wasn't a particularly nice idea, but he didn't want to break the rules and get a visit from Master Kohga.

He dropped the fruit and grabbed a handful of a nearby fruit. He had no idea which one it was, but didn't much care. He needed to silence her. Now.
Marching up to Raven, he grabbed her face with one of his hands, forcing her mouth open.
"I am sorry, but you've forced my hand," He growled, staring into Raven's blue eyes.
He dropped the fruit in, forcing her to chew. "The way I see it, you aren't a Yiga. Not if you insist on helping the enemy!"

Looking back at the box, the man saw that the fruit would...
15533112212222122222111111122212111212.title: Forced Expulsion

choices: Whoops! Raven fell asleep. Soon Yiga backup arrives and they head to the hideout
Raven's mind is filled with some... new ideas. (Something Else)
155331122122221222221111111222121112121.content:
This soft blue brain fruit was mushier than the pink looking ones and tasted a little... different. Sorta... soft? Even she knew that wasn't a flavor, but it just seemed sort of... pleasant and warm and fuzzy. But she had bigger concerns.

"Let.... go!" Raven cried, her feeble body straining against her comrade's more muscular one. Under the disguise, he was probably just a little older than her and, due to the fat fruit, twice as strong.

"Stop fighting." He ordered, voice quiet but firm. He'd shifted so he could stand behind the dissident with one hand around her tummy and one hand around her neck.

"N-no...!" As if she'd stop now! This guy was a total jerk, and she had to get her best bud outta here! Even if she did look kinda hawt like that...

The man frowned for a couple seconds, knowing full well the girl wouldn't break free all that fast. Hm... How did this fruit work again? Perhaps...? "You look very tired...."

"Wh..." How did... he know she was so sleepy...? "Wha...?"

That was it. "Why don't you just... relax?"

"I-I..." His words buzzed and bounced around her hollow head, each ricochet reminding her of how hard it was to stay awake.

"Relax, relax, relax..." The gentle tone seemed to be much more effective and wore down her will quickly. Her brain wasn't very big, so it was to be expected her mental fortitude wouldn't push back too hard.

"R-Relax...?" It was like she had to struggle over every second to stop from falling asleep right then and there!

"Just let all your thoughts go and fall deep into a trance..." He wasn't entirely sure if she knew what a trance was, but it was worth a shot. And judging by the look of total emptiness in her eyes and on her face, she'd fallen quite deep.
155331122122221222221111111222121112121.title: Hypnotic Fruit

choices: Raven wants to be more like Zelda...
1553311221222212222211111112221211121212.content:
Eventually, Raven's somewhat small body fell limp in his arms. She was still awake, as her eyes lazily looked around the room, but he doubted that she'd cause trouble. That fruit would hold her under his control for a good while, at least until someone came to check up on him.

"Stay there. And don't even think about moving!" He warned Raven, propping her up against the obese Zelda. He didn't want to leave them unattended, but the Yiga didn't provide him with an apprentice, and he still had a job to do.
"Now, if I could catch that Zora and the damnable Gerudo, I could get out of here..." He muttered, leaving the tent.

After a couple of minutes, Raven's mind returned. She was still out of it, and if someone told her to do something, she'd still obey, but for the moment, she could move. And do stuff.
"Like, hi, Silly~" Raven giggled nervously, seeing that she was next to Zelda. "How are ya?"
Zelda responded by drooling a little, which caused Raven to chuckle.
"Ya're so silly, Silly!"
She played with Zelda's expansive belly, which caused the dumbed down Princess to coo happily. She could barely operate, but she could identify Raven's soft touch.

"Raven..." Zelda murmured quietly, before giggling. Raven joined in, running her hands over Zelda's belly.
"Like, Silly' s belly feel good..." Raven said to herself, entranced by the size of her friend. How soft she looked... She was like a bed! A super comfy bed!
Raven smiled. A very rare idea had just entered her head, and she wanted to act it out before she forgot...
1553311221222212222211111112221211121212.title: A rare idea appears!

choices: The man comes back and sends Raven upfront so he can check the princess.
Keep eating? What about the brain fruit? (Something Else)
1553311221222212222211111112221211121212.content:
With a cute little gasp, Raven's face brightened and she smiled. "Wait here, Silly. I'ma be riiight back!"

"Kaaay...!" Zelda moaned, one hand mindlessly rubbing her bigger belly. She wasn't thinking much these days, but simple responses like that were second nature.

Giggling and trembling in excitement, Raven moved to the box of fruit on the other side of the backroom. Digging through, she found a bunch of brainy brain fruit but left it there. She didn't like it as much as the juicy one she'd had earlier. And after digging and searching for a long while, the black haired beauty eventually found three good pieces near the bottom. She would've liked more, but she just wanted to eat. To be big. Big and soft and pretty like Silly!

Making it halfway back to her buddy, Raven suddenly stopped. The brain fruit wasn't as good as the fat fruit, but... did it make her bigger? She was still kinda tired from working so hard.

"Mmm..." She pranced it place for a couple seconds, then ran back and grabbed three small pink ones for later. She didn't wanna be too big. But... it would be nice to, y'know, be so...

CRUNCH

She wiped the juice from her face and felt some arm jiggle. Blushing and giggling, she took another

CRUNCH

And threw the first fat fruit to the side. She looked down. Her arms were fat and her thighs touched and rocked back and forth. She breathed heavy and felt her bigger belly, then the softer breasts, and pressed her face to feel softness all around. She wasn't skinny anymore, but... if she kept going she'd be too big to do work an' stuff...
1553311221222212222211111112221211121212.title: Mushy Mind, Mushy Body

choices: "Get back in there, and don't touch anything!"
"Keep it up. I need to... meet someone".
1553311221222212222211111112221211121212.content:
Before she could start on another fruit, the tent flap flew open, revealing the man, who looked somewhat annoyed.
"Oi, you!" He commanded, looking towards Raven.
Still under the affects of the hypno fruit, Raven's mind went blank. She looked towards her current master, her eyes glazed over.

"Take the front for a while. I need to, uh... Check on the stock," He said, his eyes initially landing on Zelda before moving towards a box.
"Like, of course!"
Raven marched out to the front of the tent, the brain fruit and fat fruits still clutched in her hands. She quickly shoved them into her pockets as she pushed aside the flap.

She was met with a couple of annoyed looking customers, who instantly perked up when she wandered out.
"Finally!" One of them said. She was a rather large woman, who was petting her belly affectionately. Raven couldn't tell if she was pretty, like Silly in the back, or holding a baby. Either way, she was eyeing some of the fat fruit hungrily.

"I'll take the whole box!" She said quickly, still rubbing her large belly.
"Kay!" Raven said, lifting the box and handing it to her. She didn't even ask for payment, and looked surprised when a silver rupee was pressed into her hand.
"Buy yourself a little something, sweetie," The woman said, smiling at Raven.

As the woman waddled off, a dopey looking woman wandered up, her eyes unfocused.
"Like, hi..." She said, looking past Raven. "Like, small fruit?"
Raven nodded, grabbing a handful of the small fruits and handing them to the woman, who gave a dopey smile and dropped a handful of rupees onto the table. She wandered off, bumping into a barrel as she did.

Before any more customers arrived, the man reappeared. He looked at the small pile of rupees Raven had accumulated with interest.
"Good work. I should keep you around," He said. "Now..."
1553311221222212222211111112221211121212.title: The Bestest Shopkeeper

choices: "Oh! Are ya, like, parta the Yiga clan now?"
"So how'd you get all small an' stuff?" (Something Else)
1553311221222212222211111112221211121212.content:
"Yessir!" Raven giggled and tried to salute, then ran back inside. Anything anyone said would just absorb into her suggestible mind. The hypno fruit would wear off soon enough. Or not. ... Eventually.

Inside the tent, now, Raven found there wasn't a whole lot of fruit anymore. A few brain fruit and a fat fruit, sure, but that wasn't enough for anybody. Though, she couldn't quite put her finger on it, but something was missing...

"Oomph!" Something heavy knocked her over.

"Heya, Raven!"

The yiga saleswoman gasped. "Is that--?"

"Yup!" Silly giggled and rolled off her friend. "Sorry..."

"Ah, don't worry about It." She turned to face her much thinner friend, who, strangely, wore a cowl and... Was that a Yiga clan outfit?! "You look great!"

"Really?" Silly blushed and played girlishly with a lock of her blonde hair. She stil had a double chin, but that was implied much less weight than the blob of a girl she was before. "I feel a li'l... small.

"Yeah!" Raven gushed, oblivious to the strangeness of her friend's transformation. "You could totally pull off sumthin' this skinny! Especially in that totally cute uniform ya got on~!" She showed off s bit of her own Yiga clan gear to emphasize their matchingness.

"Aww," Silly batted her friend's arm playfully. "Thanks, Raven. I think you look super good, too."
1553311221222212222211111112221211121212.title: "Get back in there!"

choices: Meanwhile, Zelda's been returned to normal and waits TF in the Yiga Clan Hideout
Raven is taken to where all other TF'ed people are (Something Else)
1553311221222212222211111112221211121212.content:
"Hello~!" Raven struck a pose and giggled. "Welcome to the, um, goodest fruit shop!!"

Three guards and a half naked body builder lady pushed past her and started to search the tent.

"Um... Like, see anything ya like?" Raven kept a smile and laughed nervously as clatters and crashes erupted.

"Ma'am," One of the guards walked up with a notepad and pen in hand. "I'd like to ask you some question."

"Okay." Raven nodded, frowning. "Um, can your friends be more--?"

"Do you run this fruit stand?" She kept eye contact through every word. Aggressive and uncomfortable eye contact.

The chubby bimbo pouted, feeling a little pressured. "R-Run...?"

"Do you own this fruit stand?" Her interrogater elaborated.

"Oh." Raven shook her head. "No."

She wrote something into the book, scribbling furiously. Raven, all the while, took nervous glances to the back and to the girl in front of her. "How long have you worked here?"

"Since this afternoon." Raven's feet were turned shyly in as she put her hands together before her waist. She wasn't sure what was going on, but it didn't seem very good.

"And what is your connection to the Yiga clan?"

"Yiga...?" Raven tilted her head. "Yiga... That sounds, like, really... cool...?" Her eyes scrolled up and to the right and her jaw slackened. "For some reason?"

With a snap, the guard's notebook closed shut. "We're going to need you to come with us."
1553311221222212222211111112221211121212.title: The Hyrule PD

choices: Recognizing the Yiga in the room, Zelda calls the guards.
1553311221222212222211111112221212.content:
"Here you are, princess." The semi-old vendor said, placing a bitter looking blue fruit into Zelda's pudgy palm. "Eat up!"

"Uh... Mister?" Raven beckoned the man over with a small but frantic wave.

"Yes?"

"Yaay...!" Zelda half whispered and half squealed, instantly popping the thing into her mouth.

"We don't got, like," Raven pursed her lips and folded her arms. "Any money."

"Oh, don't worry about that." The man snorted, waving a hand dismissively. "If she doesn't do her thing then everyone dies anyway, so what's a little piece of fruit matter?"

In the background, the princess puckered her lips and spat, the sour and bitter fruit leaving behind a horrid taste. But, moments after, a splitting headache struck her right between the eyes. It was like someone was pumping... something into her head!

"Y-Yeah, but..." The ditz nervously played with a lock of her pretty black hair.

"Relax, sweetheart. If I wanted anything in return, I wouldn't have given it to her to begin with." His smile was warm and inviting, and she couldn't help but giggle and smile shyly back. "And her father owns the kingdom." Zelda's waist line was down to half of what it was a minute ago as definition returned to her body. "Who knows? Perhaps I'll be rewarded yet."

Smiling, Raven opened her mouth to respond, but something caught her eye. Turning slowly as her eyes grew wide, Raven looked dead at her seemingly unsilly friend's svelte new form. "Whoa..." Was all she could say.

"Wh-what's...?" The blonde brainiac murmured, intelligent thought flowing freely again inside her mind. "Going on?"

"Hello, princess." The man greeted pleasantly. "You--"

"Wh-where are my clothes?!" She cried, gaping at the scraps of cloth draped around her body.

Elena looked out over the African countryside, the vast plain stretching out in front of her as far as she could see. She giggled as the wind blew across her exposed legs and stomach, wearing nothing but her white skimpy string outfit. She had come out here today because she had heard that someone from her tribe had found a suspicious fruit that nobody had ever seen before. But just because this was a mission, and just because she had traveled from her school and away from her friends Ibuki and Makoto to do it, didn't mean she still didn't find and excuse to have fun while out here.

"Ah what a beautiful day, wouldn't you agree Mister Dog," she asked of a stray animal that was walking past that barely turned to look at her as it walked past. "Fine, be that way," she said jokingly. It was then that she noticed a bizarre fruit near where the dog had just walked. She sprinted over there and saw several other pieces of the fruit and followed the track, until she found a strange orange tree with yellowish orange fruit hanging from it. "This is it," she shouted in victory. "Now to just take these and see what exactly they are. They feel so light," she said as she took the fruit down. "Huh, wonder if these things are poisonous, they don't look it, look pretty good actually. Maybe I should..."

Alrighty, lets get to it... Up first there's Jaina and Alexstrasza, two of the more popular femme characters.

Jaina Proudmoore: The human mage and a prime target for the enemy horde. There's plenty of options for her, whether it be by sabotage or accident. Magic is pretty sketchy, anything could go wrong! And the enemy Horde could certainly find a way to 'slow' down the genius of a mage.

Alexstrasza the Lifebinder, leader of the ruby flight! She seems like a decent target. In her elf form she'd be quite easy to deal with, considering her openness. Just anyone could do something to stunt the mighty dragonqueen in some way or another... Or she could accidentally do it herself, who knows?

Well, there's the two most popular ladies, let's get them draining and gaining!
15533222222222221.title: Warcraft Ladies

choices: Out for a walk, visit the mage district for a leisurely stroll
To an odd new store, full of trinkets and oddities.
155332222222222211.content:
Jaina Proudmoore sat in her oak chair, reading over various librams and tomes. She sighed, flipping another page, all the material in front of her starting to seriously feel like dry toast - boring beyond belief. 'I need to get out of this stuffy tower, I'm not going to get any proper studying done like this.' She thought, closing her massive book with a thud. She stood from her chair and stretched, doing her best to recover from tedious hours reading.

She smoothed out her commonly worn robe, patches of skin here and there proudly on display. Jaina swept her white and blonde hair to the side, reaching out to grab her crystalline staff. 'Alright, now where to?' She pondered...
155332222222222211.title: Jaina

choices: Let me give your special stock a look!
1553322222222222112.content:
'Ahhh, that's right! Dagon's Trinket Emporium just opened up, I've been meaning to go!' The mage smiled, breaking out of her normally studious behavior for a bit of fun. She reasoned that a break from work would help, besides, she was always busy and deserved some time away from books. Jaina recalled seeing the sign in the mage district of Stormwind, over in the back. She wondered how the business would be, considering not much foot traffic goes through there, but what did she have to lose?

Jaina walked out the door whilst fastening her cloak, a chill winter breeze still present. "I guess a walk wad out of question anyway..." A slight shiver running down her back. The streets were rather empty this time of day, most townspeople out for work, save a few adventurers out and about in a rush. It felt good to not be pressured and rushed for once, when's the last time she did something like this? She couldn't recall.

The mage mused to herself as she walked through the city, not bothering to use a teleportation spell. As she rounded the corner, Jaina could hear a sign swinging back and forth in the wind, which was really started to pick up. Sure enough, the sound was sourced as the destination Jaina was looking for, 'I hope they've got a fore going...' She thought, her skin chilled by the nip of winter.

She opened the shop door with a ringing bell sounding off her entrance, closing the door hard behind as she walked in. It looked to be empty, not counting the elderly man behind the counter who'd just turned to face his visitor, "Lady Proudmoore! Welcome welcome!" The man scurried, doing his best to clean up the rather cluttered desk.

"The pleasure's all mine," she smiled, putting her hand up to keep him from overreacting, "There's no need to tidy up, I'm just here for a break from studies." Her eyes already wondering around the admittingly large store; shelves and boxes everywhere. Things from every corner of the earth and beyond.

"Ahhh, even better! Let me know if you need help finding anything, id be honored to assist!" The man piped up, a spark of excitement in his old eyes. "I've got some special ones set off to the side just in case someone like you came in."

Jaina laughed, "Alright, I could use some help in that case!"
1553322222222222112.title: Peaked Curiosity

15533222222222221122.content:
"Show me your special stock, you've more than caught my interest!" Jaina was excited to see just what he meant, enough of the things around the store looked intriguing on their own, but if he has more... She was dying to look at them.

The shopkeep rubbed his hands together, "Perfect! I know just what to show you, Ms. Proudmoore! Give me one moment!" He turned his back and popped open a hatch below him, disappearing from the mage's view. Within moment however, a clattering was heard as the man climbed a stepladder back up. "Here we are... Locked up tight." He drops a heavy chest atop his desk, one that doesn't seem like he'd be able to carry at his age... But before Jaina could question it, the man popped open the lock with the lid springing open.

"Oh wow..." Jaina stared at the treasures before her. Everything from a shining gold crown to a small tribal looking totem. She could feel the magic radiating off each of them, their aura quite strong. "There's a lot here, where do we start?" Jaina leaned on the counter to peer over each trinket.

"Well, I have some in mind that just might fit the bill." He rummages through the chest, pulling aside an item or two, neatly lining them up on the counter. "Alrighty. First we have this little beauty, known to a select few as 'The Stone of Anaa'. Not much information on this one, as I got it from an anonymous seller." The bauble looked to be a very smooth lack stone, almost impossibly so. It was fastened on a necklace of fine silver. It drew in Jaina's eyes as she looked at it, she had to shake her head just to stop.

"Alright, next up..." The shop keeper loudly rummaged through, "Ahaa, the Circlet of Emptiness! I know it sounds ominous, but the bit of information I have on it suggests that it's not dangerous by any means." The circlet looked quite simple at first glance, a solid gold loop, but on a second look, you'd notice all the fine carvings of ornate swirls. Jaina felt compelled to wear the oddity, but slowly looked back up to the old man. "Both have less than satisfactory information, especially due to my own magical limits." He thumbed his fingers against the wooden desk, "So I was wondering if you'd experiment with them a bit? Considering you're a world class mage and all..." He trailed off, unsure of how she'd answer.

"I'd gladly lend my help! They look fascinating to say the least!" Jaina answered quickly. Fast enough to even throw her off on such a hasty decision.

"You will? That's fantastic!" The old man practically jumped in joy at her response. "If you can figure out what they do, you can keep it, its the least I can do for someone so prestigious agreeing to aid me." He flipped up the desk door to meet Jaina on the other side, "Which would you like to try?"
15533222222222221122.title: The Secret Stock

choices: Some of Jaina's intelligence drops all at once
Jaina experiences a slow and steady drop
155332222222222211222.content:
Jaina thought for a moment taking a look at both pieces, her vision getting hung up on each piece. "I'll investigate the circlet first, it looks interesting..." She said, now fully staring at the piece before picking it up.

"Perfect, perfect! If you can find anything on how it works or where it came from, you can keep it." He gave the metal piece a slight flick as Jaina felt it's engravings. "It's the least I can do for someone as prestigious as yourself offering to help." The shopkeep flung open the counter door, walking over to Jaina's side, "I have some sorting to do in the back room, let me know if you find anything." He flipped over a sign on the door, the sign now reading: 'Away for lunch.'

"Alright... Sounds good." Jaina answered back, already deep in thought. She felt it's powerful magic radiating into het hands. She was well trained in these arts, but had never heard of such a piece. It was surprisingly light, despite being fully metal. It was certainly easy on the eyes too, Jaina was infatuated with it. The gold hardly looked tarnished whatsoever, the thin swirls patterning around were masterfully crafted. The mage put it down on the counter, running a few tests here and there, none of which affected the piece. It was enchanted with stability in mind, the aura surrounding it not fading in the slightest.

Jaina had a few options here, she could test it on herself by putting it on, or put it on someone else's head and see how that goes. But the more she considered it looked at the piece, the more Jaina wanted to try wearing it herself. "Oh why not, the crown could prove useful anyway, right?" She rationalized. But if she were fully in her proper state of mind, she'd note how unsafe such an action would be. It had to be part of the magic.

The mage lifted up the circle, brushing aside her hair. Conveniently there was a full body mirror behind her, so she took to looking at herself there. She carefully placed I on her head, the fit surprisingly comfortable. She admired how it sat on her head, she felt proud and beautiful. "Perhaps it makes the wearer irresistible?" Jaina said out loud. Though there was a growing sensation in the back of her mind, only minor for now but progressing either way. It wasn't a pain ad much as it was a fog.

As it spread, Jaina felt a rush all at once, like an intense migraine. "Aaghh!" She yelped rubbing her temples. As soon as it came, the sensation left...
155332222222222211222.title: The Circlet of Emptiness

choices: She felt something change in her mind, and a growing hunger
Jaina started to slowly bloat up with fat!
1553322222222222112221.content:
After the pain subsided, Jaina recovered her balance, propping up off the counter which she leaned on for support. "Ughh... that hurt..." She rubbed her head, a strange new sensation coming over her just as the pain subsided. She felt her thoughts almost... floating away. Her head felt emptier, her thoughts simpler. "Mmm, what's happening?" She questioned, but soon that too faded, leaving her air-headed and low on attention span.

Jaina dodged her own previous question, her mind drifting to her surroundings, "Wow, this is like, cool." She flicked her hair over her shoulder to get a better look at the items on the shelves. Jaina giggled to herself. 'Giggling? I don't giggle...', but again, her mind wandered. Her gaze inevitably landed back on the counter, where the trunk of special stock sat open. The pendant that the shopkeeper showed her was the first thing that caught her attention. "That's like, so pretty."

Jaina picked up the pendant, almost hypnotized by it. She really felt like wearing it, so she slipped it over her head, the stone fitting perfectly between her breasts. She looked down and giggled, "I look so cute!" She felt really bubbly!

Just as Jaina started to look at herself in the mirror she felt a new sensation, not the same as before. The stone pendant began glowing, emanating warmth all over her body. Something began to change...
1553322222222222112221.title: Disappearing Thoughts

choices: Jaina eats her whole 'dinner' without interruption
Once Jaina starts eating, the relics effect her once more...
15533222222222221122211.content:
Jaina felt her stomach growl hungrily, as if she hadn't eaten in the longest time. Her air-headed brain refused to let her question what was going on, let alone fix it, "Ughh, I'm like, soooo hungry..." She rubbed at her midsection with a slightly pained expression, "Gotta like, get some food." She groaned, walking out of the store with the sound of a bell following as she left. Jaina even forgot her staff in the store, her thoughts only focused on getting food now.

The young mage smelled food being cooked down the street, the cold winter winds fading for the time being. She walked over in that direction, lulled on by the prospect of sating her angry stomach. "Mmm, that smells good..." She turned the corner and found herself standing in front of a large establishment known as 'The Lion's Pride Buffet', not that Jaina paid any mind so long as there was food inside

She walked through the doors, flicking hair out of her eyes, a waiter met her inside. "Miss Proudmoore! I had no idea you were coming, are you by any chance wanted to dine here tonight?" His voice was filled with surprise, his words rushed.

"Im like, really hungry..." Jaina mumbled, much to the surprise of the waiter serving her.
"W-Well alright, straight this way..." The man lead Proudmoore to a private table, "I hope this will do for accommodations on such short notice?" To which Jaina blankly ignored him, picking up her plate and walking the direction of the food.

Jaina's steps seemingly guided here wherever they wanted, steering her to the desert area straight away, "Ugh, this looks like, SO good." She piled her plate high with all manner of sweets, from gnomish ice cream to night elven spider cakes. The mage had a massive assortment, samples from every Alliance culture. She brought the platter back to her dining space with a huff, grabbing a fork and knife to eagerly chow down...
15533222222222221122211.title: A Growling Belly

choices: The Stone of Anaa grew brighter, yet another effect surfaces
Jaina falls asleep at the table, her large meal lulling her to bed
155332222222222211222112.content:
Jaina carefully cut a piece of cake and stuck in her mouth, chewing slowly. As she did, the stone around her neck began to hum lightly, not that she noticed. The creamy chocolate went from delicious to irresistible, forcing Jaina to quickly shovel another forkful in her mouth. Jaina hungrily devoured bite after bite, the growling in her stomach only growing stronger. "Ummf, soooo good..." She groaned between bites, her slice of decadent cake quickly disappearing.

As she finished the last corner of her cake, Jaina wasted no time moving to another one. She ate with more and more haste, not only to quell her enlarged appetite, but to taste the food's rich flavor. The mage sampled each different item she'd gathered, moaning unconsciously. Her mind only filled with mindless bliss.

The more Jaina began to pile away, the more her sense of manners started to fade... Where once she was reserved and polite, behavior befitting of someone with her statue; now quickly devoured anything in front of her, staining her mouth with frostings and chocolate. After half her 'meal' was finished, Jaina did away with her utensils, grabbing a brownie and cookie in each hand, barely giving herself time to breath.

Luckily the restaurant was basically empty, else onlookers would watch Jaina's pig out in terror.

Jaina licked her fingers, "Mmmmm... So *urp* good..." She shameless belched mid sentence, something that would have embarrassed the mage to death was simply passed aside as nothing. If Jaina were to look at herself, she'd notice how bloated her belly was getting, but in such a blind frenzy, she was very far from noticing.


*Buuuuurp*... Then young mage marked her finished meal with a triumphant belch, licking around her mouth and fingers for any remnants. As she finished cleaning herself up, Jaina looks down to her round belly, which had only now stopped growling. She felt really full, "I look like... So fat now *braap* hehehe..." She giggled, poking her taut and round midsection, naturally the rest of her body stayed in effected by her binge, she'd need to digest her meal before anything was different there.
155332222222222211222112.title: Added Effects

choices: The Circlet of Emptiness does something
1553322222222222112221121.content:
Whilst Jaina played with her food stuffed middle, the Stone of Anaa grew slightly larger, vibrating on her chest ever so slightly. "What's it doin? That feels funny, hehehe," She laughed, a new warmth boiling up in her midsection. She felt her belly sink back down to flat, she tried poking it, but it was no use. She frowned in realization. "I want a belly..." She pouted, crossing her arms over her chest.

Soon she felt the same warmth her belly experienced but all over. Within a few moments, she felt some of her body getting heavier. Inspecting once more, the air-head watched a layer of fat rise; almost like dough. She giggled, pressing her hands down as fat grew underneath. "Ohhh, I'm fat now!" She giggled, fat spreading between her fingers. She mostly felt the sensation in her belly, legs, and ass; her robes were feeling quite a bit tighter. She felt her silk robe stretch thin over her rear and belly. The fabric looked painted on at this point, with a deep divot over her bellybutton. Jaina stood up to inspect herself, taking a moment to find her new balance.

"Hehehe, I'm getting so-*URRRP* soft," Jaina felt so happy at this realization, the only thoughts swimming in her head were of food and her body at this point. The growing ceased, but Jaina was still ecstatic. She pinched and jiggled her extra inches with glee. The only thing that broke her train of 'concentration' was the smell of chocolate filling her nose once more...
1553322222222222112221121.title: Even More Effects

choices: Polish off the whole desert section
Interrupted by someone in the buffet
15533222222222221122211212.content:
"Mmm... they like, got more..." Jaina stood up, patting her softened middle. As she did, the Circlet of Emptiness sent a jolt of pain through her mind. It felt like a severe headache and only lasted a few seconds. By the time it faded, Jaina felt what thoughts she still had drift away, her mind feeling empty and dumb. "Ooooh..." She groaned, smiling happily. Her shoulders slouched and she just started giggling uncontrollably. She was obviously dumber now, past the point of bimbo. She sniffed the smell of chocolate once more, her feet guiding her in that direction.

"Mmmm, I want..." she groaned hungrily, despite just eating. Jaina didn't even grab her plate, instead just walking up to the food bar empty handed. Once there, she went away with what most people would call decency, grabbing a large fudge brownie with her hands and stuffing it whole in her mouth. She didn't bother closing her mouth, messily devouring the whole thing and gulping. "*Urrp* MMmm, gooood..." She took a handful of several cookies, biting down on all of them at once; crumbs spilled down the front of her robe. She didn't mind even the slightest getting messy, her mind only craving food.

Jaina ate the whole tray of brownies and cookies, her belly already looking swollen. She patted it on instinct, taking a few short steps to the next station of food. She licked her lips looking at the 9/10s full chocolate cake in front of her, taking a handful and eating it on the spot. *Buuurp* She belched loudly between bites, sparing no time not spent on eating.

The once proud and reserved arch-mage was now acting purely on instinct, not more than a few simple words managing to get through her faded mind.
15533222222222221122211212.title: Added Potency

choices: Waking up to shocked staff members
Sleeping through the night, but something happens.
155332222222222211222112121.content:
*BUUURRRP* Jaina polished off the cake she'd started mere minutes ago, using her hands to scoop up the chocolaty bounty. She patted her taut middle, her cake laden fingers staining her robes a bit, not that it had any effect on her. She giggled with glee, knowing nothing but enjoyment at the moment. All the spells she once new are beyond uncastable in her current state, the Circlet Of Emptiness living up to it's name. Were Jaina not a dumb glutten at the moment, she'd have finally figured out it's name sake.

The archmage moved further down the line, greeted with eclairs and doughnuts, which she wasted no time getting started on. Even though she'd eaten more than most humans do in a month, her stomach still growled for more. "Hehe, choclate..." she mumbled, the word had finally returned to her. Jaina took a stack of donuts and placed one on each finger, devouring every last one. As she continued her instinctive eating, her robe began to pop a few seams on either side, finally giving in to the tightness it was faced with. The love handles she'd recently acquired were finally showing, slivers of creamy skin now peaking through the opened slits.

Jaina showed no signs of stopping, clearing out the eclairs and doughnuts without slowing. Her mouth was stained in powered sugar and chocolate cream, something that didn't bother Jaina, who seemed to have no shame. *Braaap* She belched more and more frequently as she continued her crusade.

All that was left for Jaina to ravage was the large tub of Gnomish ice-cream, which guaranteed not to melt. She'd soon test that theory, scooping up the strawberry flavored treat. It was cold, but it didn't bother her too much as she was eating much too fast. "Ughhh, so tired..." she grumbled, the fullness in her belly finally catching up with her. She scooped up the last bit of ice-cream, belching in victory. Now that she polished off the whole thing, the ice-cream also caught up with her, a sharp brain freeze coursing through her head. She grunted in pain, massaging her forehead until it went away.

Content with her feast and feeling bloated, Jaina Proudmoore sat straight on the ground, leaning her back on the now empty food table. She cradled her sensitive stomach before nodding off to sleep.
155332222222222211222112121.title: Finishing What She Started

15533222222222222.content: Cynder from the legend of Spyro.
15533222222222222.title: Spyro, maybe?

155332222222222221.content: Will it be quick or slow.
155332222222222221.title: Yeah, fat stupid dragon.

1553322222222222211.title: But how?

choices: Ember finds Cinder and is ready to use her spells...
Ember finds Cinder and Spyro together. She uses her spells on Cinder anyway...
1553322222222222212.content:
Ember, the pink-scaled dragon who used to crush on Spyro, was now plotting on taking down her new rival. She had heard of Spyro's developing relationship with Cinder. She had noticed the two dragons bonding for a while now, but she would shrug it off and assume Cinder wouldn't take Spyro away from her. She had thought wrong, and now she was paying the price. Cinder and Spyro were going out and it was because of her negligence. Luckily, Ember had planned to remedy her mistake by searching for a way to ruin Cinder and make Spyro scorn her. Ember didn't plan to harm her rival, but she did want to find a way to make her repulsive.

Ember searched through a huge mound of scrolls, which she gathered from various other dragons across the realm. She hoped at least one of them would give a decent spell that could change Cinder for the worst.

"Hmmm... There has to be a good spell here somewhere," Ember said as she took out another scroll and skimmed through it. She mostly paid attention to the spells effects as opposed to how to do them. No point in learning a spell if she didn't know whether it did what she wanted it to do after all. Ember had been searching for a few hours so far, her determination to win back Spyro driving her to this point.

Eventually, after so much searching, Ember was almost ready to give up, until she found two scrolls paired up together. One scroll effected the mind. It allowed the user of the spell to control any other living being's mind, including deducting or adding IQ points, changing memories, behavior, etc. The other spell simply controlled the body. It allowed the user to change a being's weight, physical strength level, and how the organs operate. Ember chuckled evilly to herself. "Ooh, Spyro, you will soon be mine..." she told herself with a wicked smile ending it off.

Ember quickly went out in search of Cinder.
1553322222222222212.title: Quick.

15533222222222222121.content:
The air had a heavy rosy smell. Ember trotted along the walkway, her head zipping left and right, in search for the black dragoness, the magic scroll clamped in her jaws. Butterflys zoomed over her head, flapping gracefuly in the wind. A black figure caught the pink dragoness's attention. Creeping silintly through the flowers, Ember spotted Cynder walking along the cobbled path, sniffing at a flower every now and then.

She looked so peacful, completely unaware of the pink dragoness hiding between the sweet scented plants. Now was the time to strike. Onrolling the scroll, Ember read the words quickly, loudly, and clearly. When she was finished, Ember looked up at Cynder with a evil grin, but it faded from her face. Cynder still looked completely normale, just standing there, motionless.

Ember felt her heart race. She expected Cynder to turn around any time now, but, for some reason, she didn't. Emerging from the flowers, Ember slowly walled towards the black dragoness, saying,"Cynder?" There was no reply. Ember walked in front of Cynder. Her irisis where two black discs staring into nothing, her face completely emotionless. "She's only hipnotized,' Ember realised. She waved her paw in front of her face, making sure she was correct. She was.

Ember reached out with her paw and touched Cynder's forehead. Suddenly Ember was bombarded with strange flashes; flashes that told of a Cynder's life, the knowledge she had, the things that made her a computent dragon. Ember gasped, ripping away her paw. The flashes instantly stopped. She breathed heavely in shock. 'I was in her mind,' Ember thought to herself, looking at the paw that touched Cynder.

The pink dragoness walked over to Cynder body and then she touched her stomach. This time there was no flashes that attacked her, but things that she felt inside Cynder. She could feel her iner workings: her beating heart, her stomace working to digest food from within her bowels.

Ember pulled away. She stood there for some time before a evil grin spreaded across her face. She had complete control over her, to shape her body's organs and mind. But the important question was, whice should she shape first? After some thinking, She dicided to...
15533222222222222121.title: Ember finds Cinder and is ready to use her spel...

choices: Wait! Maybe she should mess up Cinder's body more first...
155332222222222221211.content:
Ember decided to shape Cinder's body first, then her mind following it. The pink dragoness touched her rival's stomach. She could see and feel everything in Cinder's body now. "Okay, what could I do to make Cinder a putrid, self-humiliating dragon?" Ember asked herself. There were so many possibilities. Ember knew the first thing she should do is make Cinder fat, then add any extras later. Ember was about to question herself on how to do anything she pleased to Cinder, but then, immediately as the words "Cinder" and "fat" came to mind, Cinder's body suddenly expanded.

Cinder grew a medium-sized pot-belly, which resided between all four of her meatier-looking limbs. Her butt and tail grew by a considerable amount, but nothing extreme (Yet). Cinder looked like she would gain a double-chin if any more weight were added. Overall, she definitely grew wider. In fact, overall she grew bigger. Cinder seemed to gain 100lbs. Ember couldn't help but gasp at how much weight Cinder already gained. She smirked wickedly as evil ideas traversed through her head. Why just make her chubby or even fat? Better to make her morbidly obese so even something as simple as breathing seems to need work!

Just as Ember thought all this, Cinder's weight matched the order. Her butt and tail sized up to an enormous level, as her cheeks were now bigger than basketballs. Her belly grew to the point of hitting the floor. Cinder's gut would now rub against the ground whenever she would walk. Not two, but three chins, along with chipmunk-cheeks were over the dragoness's face. Cinder's limbs were very flabby, and would jiggle from even the smallest movements. Her claws were fat-looking too.

Cinder looked like she expanded up to 450lbs. now. Ember smiled and marveled at her work. Just to add the icing in the cake, Ember thought "Maybe I should make her gassy and wet, too." Cinder's saliva-production would be kicked into overdrive, and her digestive system would be destroyed. When she would awake, she would be a gassy, drooling mess.

Ember spoke, "Now for the brain..."
155332222222222221211.title: Shape her body.

choices: Exactly what you think: a dumb, slobby mess.
1553322222222222212111.content:
Ember spoke,"Now for the brain..." She walked over to Cynder's head and placed her paw on her forehead. Images flash before her eyes. Focusing, Ember started to manipulate Cynder's IQ levels, regressing it to a much simpler state.

Ember giggled as she moved to the next part-her memories. She altered it, destroying the moments she had with Spyro, and filling her mind with new ones of food and slobyness.

When she was done, Ember stood back, observing her masterpiece. Little bit of drool leaked out of Cynder's mouth, soiling her chines, and her belly made frightening gurgle noises.

Feeling satisfied, Ember released the hold on Cynder. But what happens?
1553322222222222212111.title: Brain time!

choices: Spyro arrives and Cynder makes a fool of herself...
Turns out there was a side-effect to the spell... (Ember changes too)
15533222222222222121111.content:
Cynder was finally starting to move again, however the most movement Ember would see was her heavy, labored breathing, likely due to all the excess weight on her. The dragoness farted and smiled before scratching her rump with her front claw. Ember knew Cynder was definitely fat, slobby, and dumb, but she wanted to test just how stupid she really was. "Hey Cynder," Ember said. "How're you."

Cynder's drooling kicked into overdrive as a long, slow "Duuuuuuuuhhhh...." can be heard. Cynder was obviously thinking of a response, but was having difficulty. Just then, Ember heard another loud fart, followed by a large stream of crap emanating from Cynder's big ass. She was clearly so brain-dead that she didn't even have any knowledge of potty-training. "Heheheheheeeh... Me make boom-boom..." Cynder giggled slowly and moronically. Ember cheered in her head. She knew there was no way Cynder was going to be accepted by Spyro now. She only wished her crush was here to see her rival now.

"This is great!" Ember cheered to herself.

"Grapes nasty..." said Cynder.

"No. I said great. Not grapes," Ember responded, feeling too excited to become annoyed by Cynder's idiocy.

"Oh... What great mean?" asked Cynder while picking her nose for gunk to eat.

Ember simply ignored Cynder and started to think to herself more about Spyro's reaction.
15533222222222222121111.title: Exactly what you think: a dumb, slobby mess.

choices: If she can't have him, no one can.
155332222222222221211111.content:
"Cynder!" a distant but familiar voice called. Ember's heart fluttered in her chest. 'Oh, this is gonna be good,' she thought in delight. Ember watched with amusement as Cynder's bovine-like eyes turned to the search of the noise.

"Bender? Wha' bender?" Cynder said in her retarded state. Paw-steps grew louder and louder as Spyro approached them. "Cynder, where are you?" he called again. Suddenly Spyro's head popped around the corner, his golden crest shining in the sun, reflecting towards the simple-minded Cynder.

Spyro's nostrils flared. " You did this." He pointed a guilty finger at her. "Changer her back now!" His eyes began to glow. Ember gulped. For a half a moment Ember expected that Spyro would attack her, but he just stood there. "O...okay, S...Spyro," she said in fear.

When she was done, Ember released the hold on Cynder, and the black dragoness dropped to the floor, unconscious. "Come," Spyro ordered, his paw covering his snout,"we need to get her to a bath."

Ember sighed, but reluctantly did what he asked. She knew her plan failed, and she would be hated forever by Spyro now, bit she had to do something. After cleaning her, Cynder woke up, confused but as smart as ever.

She was scolded by Spyro, and she had to leave, tears streaming down her face. 'You think this is over, Cynder? I got a nasty surprise for you, even if it means to hurt Spyro as well,' she thought angrely to herself.
